III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of Staff
Section The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency’s program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Between 10/21/23-10/22/23, youth was inappropriately touching
another youth and name calling a third youth. After being called a
name, the third youth pulled out a switchblade and threatened to
stab the name calling youth in response. Staff removed the
switchblade. A physical altercation ensued between the two youth
later in the day.
Investigation Interviews:
Law Enforcement 1/Complaint source was attempted to be
interviewed via phone on October 23,2023. Law Enforcement 1
left the main line phone number to the police department to call. The
receptionist reported Law Enforcement 1 would best be reached via
email and provided that email. This consultant emailed Law
Enforcement 1 on October 23, 2023. Law Enforcement 1 was the
officer on scene after the fight occurred and spoke with Youth A and
Youth B.
Law Enforcement 2/ Complaint Source was attempted to be
interviewed via phone on October 23, 2023. A voicemail was left
on Law Enforcement 2’s cell phone. Law Enforcement 2 was the
officer that talked with Youth C while he was being transported to
juvenile detention. Youth C disclosed to Law Enforcement 2 that
Youth B has been grabbing his butt for the past three months in a
sexual manner.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on October
26, 2023. Youth A reported a couple of months ago they AWOLed
with Youth B and Youth C from the facility. They reported while they
were AWOL, Youth B made comments to Youth A about wanting to
date them and smacked their butt. Youth A reported they did not
really think of anything of it. Youth A reported on October 21, 2023,
2

they were making breakfast and Youth B had poked their breast
when staff’s back was turned. They reported Youth B told them that
they just had to do it and Youth A reported they didn’t understand
why they did not just fully grasp their breast rather than just poke it.
Youth A reported they felt a bit uneasy about it because they are
dating Youth C but did not want to press charges against Youth B
because they just poked their breast. Youth A reported they told
Youth C about Youth B touching their breast because they wanted to
be honest with him since they are in a relationship. They reported
Youth B poked their breast again on October 22, 2023, when Youth
B was on the phone with his dad. Youth A reported they could tell
Youth C was upset and asked Staff 1 if they could go talk about the
situation. They reported they went to talk with Youth C in the den
while Staff 1 supervised. Youth A reported they told Youth C about
Youth B touching them which then got him upset and Youth C walked
out of the room to fight Youth B. Youth A reported they were not
present for both fights that occurred. They reported no concerns with
staff supervision and Youth B just poked them when the staff’s backs
were turned for a second. Youth A reported they are not allowed to
have knives at the facility and all the knives are locked up in the
home. They reported any use of a knife is supervised closely by
staff.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on October
26, 2023. Youth B reported he feels safe at the facility and does not
want to talk about the fight. He reported he has never touched
anyone inappropriately at the facility. Youth B reported staff do a
good job at supervising the youth and he has trusted staff to talk to if
he doesn’t feel safe.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on October
26, 2023. Youth C reported he got into a fight with Youth B over the
weekend because he heard Youth B had touched Youth A. He
reported he does not like Youth B and stated he has grabbed his butt
before when staff are not looking. Youth C stated he does not want to
press charges or talk to law enforcement about it. He stated it
randomly happened, and staff never witnessed it. Youth C was asked
about his switchblade, and he reported he got that from school. He
stated that he gave it up one night to a staff. Youth C stated on
October 22, 2023, he had asked Staff 3 for something out of his
personal bin and Youth C just pushed past him to get the switchblade
out of the bin. He reported he wanted it so he could crave a pumpkin
and told staff he would give it back. He reported staff have been
doing a better job with supervision since “they are always up in his
business now.” Youth C reported he has no concerns with anyone
touching another at the facility and feels safe. He reported there are
trusted staff he can talk to if he has any concerns.
3

Youth D was interviewed face to face at the facility on October
26, 2023. Youth D reported they have never seen Youth B be
inappropriate with anyone, including Youth A and Youth C. They
reported they saw Youth B flick Youth A’s breast while Youth C was
on the phone with his dad. Youth D reported it is all over relationship
drama and Youth A wants to be the center of attention. They
reported Youth C is the one who is sexually inappropriate as he is
always making sexual comments and trying to touch people. Youth D
reported staff are always redirecting the youth when they are too
close in boundaries or making inappropriate comments. Youth D
reported they were present when Youth B and Youth C got into a
physical fight. They reported Youth C assaulted Youth B because
Youth A told him that Youth B touched their breast and he is dating
Youth A. Youth D reported staff did all they could do to break up the
fight and called the police for support. They reported that they were
not present for the knife situation and reported all knives are locked
up in the house. Youth D reported Youth C gets his contraband from
school or when he is AWOL.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on October 26,
2023. Staff 1 reported he was working on October 22, 2023. He
reported Youth C had asked to get a snack out of his personal bin
and Staff 3 went to the staff bathroom to get it. Youth C rushed into
the bathroom to grab his box and got his switch blade that was in his
personal box. Staff 1 reported himself and Staff 3 attempted to ask
for the knife back as Youth C had no need for the knife. He reported
Youth C began to carve a pumpkin with the knife. Staff 1 reported he
continued to ask for the knife and communicated with Staff 3 through
text message to make sure to sit at the stop across from Youth C to
keep an eye on the knife and try to get the knife if he can. Staff 1 told
Youth C he was going to be marked down today due to refusing to
give up the knife and Youth C stated he would give it up when he
was done craving his pumpkin. Staff 1 reported Youth B came over
to the table and Youth C threatened to stab him with the knife in his
hand. He reported Youth B grabbed a butter knife from the kitchen.
Staff 1 reported he and Staff 2 got in between Youth B and Youth C.
Staff 2 was able to get the butter knife from Youth B and get him out
of the house. Youth C was told the police were being called due to
having a weapon and Youth C gave the knife to Supervisor 1 when
they were contacted about the heightened situation. Staff 1 reported
later in the day, Youth A was talking with Youth C in the hallway. He
reported he was standing in the hallway with the youth because they
were not allowed to be alone due to supervision guidelines. Youth A
asked if they could go in the den so Staff 1 followed them in there.
He reported Youth A told Youth C that Youth B had “flicked them in
their breast”. Youth C got upset over this and pushed passed Staff 1
to go attack Youth B. He reported Youth B and Youth C got into a fist
fight in the milieu area and Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 4 attempted to
4

break it up. The police had to be called due to the fight and the
escalation of behaviors. Staff 1 reported he felt staff did all they could
do to try to keep the youth safe. Staff 1 reported he has not heard or
seen concerns of Youth B touching any of the youth inappropriately.
He reported he is aware of the youth that are on peer boundaries and
that no two youth should be left alone. Staff 1 reported all knives
should be locked up from the youth. He reported no one was aware
of Youth C having a knife in his personal bin.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on October 26,
2023. Staff 2 reported she was working on October 22, 2023. She
reported Youth C was having a rough day. She reported she was not
there when Youth C grabbed the knife as she was on a walk with
Youth D. Staff 2 reported when she returned back to the home with
Youth D, Youth C already had the knife, and Staff 1 made her aware.
She reported she was able to calm Youth B down and get him to go
for a break to the gym after the knife situation. Staff 2 reported when
Youth B got back, he was doing his chores. She stated Youth A and
Youth C were talking with Staff 1 and she saw Youth C rush at Youth
B stating, “Why are you touching my girlfriend’s tits.” She reported
that was when a physical fistfight occurred between Youth C and
Youth B. Staff 2 reported she tried to assist with getting the youth
separated and at one point she was able to get them to break up and
Youth B went into his room. But once he came out, the fight
happened again, and both of the youth ended up outside with Staff 1
and Staff 4. She stated she called the police and stayed in the home
with the other youth. She stated the police came and arrested Youth
C. Staff 2 reported she had never seen or heard concerns of Youth B
touching another youth inappropriately. She stated she always
reminds the youth of safe hands and safe feet. Staff 2 reported she is
aware of the peer boundary plans that are in place with the youth.
Staff 3 was interviewed via phone on November 7, 2023. Staff 3
reported on October 22, 2023, he was working the first shift. He
reported Youth C had asked him for his personal bin in the staff
bathroom to get a comb. When he went to the staff bathroom, Youth
C followed him to the staff bathroom and grabbed his own bin. Staff 3
reported he did not know there was a switchblade within the personal
bin and saw Youth C grab it out. He reported Youth C sat at the table
and told staff he wanted to use the switchblade to crave a pumpkin.
Staff 3 reported he and Staff 1 encouraged Youth C to give the
switchblade back because it was not safe. He reported Youth C was
getting irritated with staff and was trying to make jokes that he was
going to harm himself or someone else with the blade. Staff 3
reported they were able to get Youth C to agree to give the
switchblade up once he was done carving the pumpkin. He reported
he was communicating with Staff 1 to make sure to keep an eye on
the situation and sat close to Youth C. Staff 3 reported he switched
5

out with Staff 2 as his shift was over and did not want to escalate
Youth C any further. Staff 3 reported any contraband items needs to
be locked up with the program manager and he did not understand
why the switchblade would be locked up in the youth’s personal bin.
Staff 3 reported he was not present for any fights that occurred.
Staff 4 was interviewed face to face at the facility on October 26,
2023. Staff 4 reported she was working the night shift on October 22,
2023. She reported when she walked into the home around 7:55 pm,
Youth C was running towards Youth B. She reported she tried to
break up the fight and ended up getting hit by the youth. Staff 4
reported she followed Youth B and Youth C when they were fighting
outside of the home and Staff 2 stayed in the home with the other
youth. She reported there was good communication between all the
staff on how to handle the situation and at the end the police were
contacted. Staff 4 reported she had never seen or heard of Youth B
being sexually inappropriate with any of the youth. She reported she
has had to redirect the youth from horseplaying with one another.
She reported whenever she sees a youth too close to another youth,
she will stand in between them. Staff 4 reported she is aware of the
peer boundaries guidelines and also that if any youth is awake, they
need to have eyes on supervision.
Staff 5 was interviewed face to face at the facility on October 26,
2023. Staff 5 reported she works third shift at the facility. She
reported on October 19, 2023, Youth C woke up in the middle of the
night and continued to knock on Youth A’s bedroom door. Staff 5
reported she continued to redirect Youth C to leave Youth A’s room
alone and continued to block the door. After some coaching, Staff 5
was able to get Youth C to go sit in the milieu and he processed
about some anniversaries of loved ones who had passed away.
Youth C denied wanting to process or use any coping skills about
these situations and went back to Youth A’s bedroom door. Youth A
was able to give Youth C a dab pen and staff tried to get it from
Youth C but he refused. Youth C rushed to the bathroom to use the
dab pen and Staff 5 called Supervisor 2 about the whole situation.
Youth C came out of the bathroom and showed staff he had a
switchblade and torch lighter. After a little bit of time, Staff 5 was able
to get the switchblade and torch lighter from Youth C and put it in his
personal bin in the locked staff bathroom. Staff 5 reported they called
Supervisor 2 about the situation, and she told Staff 5 to keep the
items locked up and Supervisor 1 would take care of the contraband
items. She reported she does not know exactly where Youth A and
Youth C got the dab pen, switchblade, and torch lighter but believes
they got them at school because that is how they get most of their
contraband items. Staff 5 reported they have never had a youth
report concerns to them about another youth inappropriately touching
them. She reported she has redirected Youth C about boundaries
6

with Youth A and the sexual comments he makes. Staff 5 reported
she has never had any concerns with Youth B.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
October 26, 2023. Supervisor 1 reported most of the youth within the
home are on peer boundaries meaning the staff need to make sure
there is continued appropriate space between the youth. She
reported she has never heard or saw concerns of Youth B touching
Youth A. Supervisor 1 reported she has seen Youth B and Youth C
horseplay a lot and that gets redirected but there were never
concerns of touching inappropriately. She reported she was the
supervisor on campus on October 22, 2023. Supervisor 1 reported
she received a text message from Staff 1 stating Youth C had a knife
but at the time was not threatening to harm himself or others with it
and staff were trying to get the knife back. She reported she received
a phone call from Staff 2 stating Youth C was threatening Youth B
with the knife. Supervisor 1 reported she called 911 for support with
this and then met with Youth C outside. She stated Youth C ended
up giving over the knife. Supervisor 1 reported she was not aware
there was a knife in Youth C’s personal bin. She stated if a youth
ever needs something out of their personal bin, staff should be
getting it for the youth and the youth should not be going in the staff
bathroom.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed via phone on October 26, 2023.
Supervisor 2 reported she was the supervisor on-call on October 19,
2023. She reported she received a phone call from Staff 5 due to
Youth C having contraband. She reported she told Staff 5 to make
sure to lock up the contraband items, including the switchblade in the
staff bathroom. Supervisor 2 reported she also told Staff 5 to make
sure to write up an incident report as well. When asked if youth are
allowed access to the staff office to grab their personal bin,
Supervisor 2 reported no youth are not allowed in there. She stated if
a youth needs their personal items youth need to ask staff
specifically for the item they want.
Chief Administrator was interviewed face to face at the facility
on October 26, 2023. Chief Administrator reported she has been
completing video review and has not found any video footage of
Youth B grabbing Youth C’s butt. She reported there has been
footage of Youth B and Youth C play fighting and staff redirecting the
situation.
Therapist 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
October 24, 2023. Therapist 1 reported she works with Youth B. She
reported there was no concerns reported to her of Youth B touching
the other youth inappropriately. Therapist 1 reported Youth B does
have a history of sexualized behaviors but have not seen those
7

concerns at the facility. Therapist 1 reported Youth B is on peer
boundaries due to the fight he had with Youth C but not because of
any reported concerns of touching.
Therapist 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
October 24, 2023. Therapist 2 reported she works with Youth A and
Youth C. She reported Youth C has never reported any concerns of
Youth B touching him inappropriately. Therapist 2 reported she just
met with Youth A for therapy earlier today and they reported no
concerns of people touching them inappropriate or anything about
Youth B.
Video Review:
Video footage of October 21, 2023, involving the concerns of Youth B
touching Youth A, was reviewed on October 26, 2023, with Chief
Administrator. The video footage begins at 10:02am and the location
is within the facility’s kitchen. Youth C and Youth D are standing on
deck, and staff are standing in the doorway from the kitchen to the
deck talking to the youth. Youth A is making breakfast on the stove
and Youth B is standing right next to them. The staff also talked with
Youth A for brief second and turned their back to look at Youth C and
Youth D on the deck. Youth B does a two second poke to Youth A’s
chest area. Staff turn right back around after this incident occurred.
Video footage of October 22, 2023, involving the concerns of Youth
C getting a knife, was reviewed on October 24, 2023, with Chief
Administrator. The video starts with Youth C sitting at the dining table
and Staff 3 sitting across from him. Staff 3 and Youth C get up from
the table and heads towards the staff bathroom. Staff 3 opens the
staff bathroom door and Youth C pushed himself into the staff
bathroom and grabbed his own personal bin. This is where Youth C
took the switch blade knife out of. Youth C sat at the table and
started to crave the pumpkin with the knife. Staff 3 remained sitting
across from Youth C and Staff 1 sat at the head of the table watching
Youth C.
Documents Reviewed:
- Facility’s Residential Privacy and Search Policy with the
most recent revision date of 02/06/2022- The facility policy
notes that a youth’s personal belongings, bedroom and/or
bathroom will be searched only under the following
circumstances: when a youth arrived for placement at the
facility, when a youth returns from AWOL, when a youth is
placed on suicide status, when conditions of precautions
dictated the need for a search, when a staff person becomes
aware of or suspects that the youth may possess harmful
and/or illicit items, or when a therapist indicated the necessity
of a search to ensure the youth’s safety and security. Any
8

illegal or dangerous items removed from a youth’s possession
will be immediately brought to the program manager. If a
program manager is not on site, staff will contact the campus
wide supervisor and make sure the items are in a secure
location. The youth’s confiscated personal items will be clearly
labeled and placed in a locked room or cabinet for
safekeeping, such as the staff bathroom or basement or
closet.
- Human Resource File and Training Records for Staff 1,
Staff 2, Staff 3, Staff 4, and Staff 5- No disciplinary action
were noted in the staff’s files prior to this investigation. All staff
were up to date on all their required trainings.
- Facility Incident report dated 10/19/2023 completed by
Staff 5- This incident report is consistent with the interview
from Staff 5 about Youth C handing over the switchblade.
- Facility Incident Report dated 10/22/2023 completed by
Supervisor 1- This incident report is consistent with the
interview with Supervisor 1 and Staff 1 about Youth C
threatening with a switchblade and receiving the switchblade
back.
- Youth A’s Peer Boundary plan dated 04/12/2023- Youth A
was placed on a peer boundary. Staff should stand and/or sit
between and redirect all inappropriate conversations and
boundary concerns with all peers.
- Youth B’s Peer Boundary plan dated 09/01/2023- Youth B
was placed on a peer boundary due to being in a prior
argument with Youth C that led to threats and a physical
altercation. Staff need to be between and redirect all
inappropriate conversations, arguments, threats, and
boundary concerns with Youth B and Youth C.
- Youth C’s Peer Boundary plan dated 09/01/2023- Youth C
was placed on peer boundary due to being in a prior argument
with Youth B that led to threats and physical alterations. Youth
C also has engaged in inappropriate physical boundaries with
multiple peers. Staff should stand between and redirect all
inappropriate conversations and boundary concerns with all
peers and Youth C. He should not be ever seated right next to
another youth in the house, outings or in vehicles.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as staff were providing
adequate supervision and followed internal policies as required. It
was found to be true of Youth B did touch Youth A’s breast but
occurred within seconds when staff’s back was turned. There was
no evidence to find it to be true of Youth B touching Youth C
inappropriately. Staff 5 followed the procedures of contacting on-
9

call supervisor and placing the switchblade in the locked staff
bathroom when found. Youth C was able to get the switchblade on
a different date when following staff into the bathroom and
grabbing his personal bin himself. When Youth C had the
switchblade, staff kept close supervision and attempted to get the
item from the youth.
Consultation:
Consultation was provided to the facility about making sure there
is clear communication of when a contraband item is taken from
the youth, where it is stored and if the item needs to be relocated.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
